title: Hosea Chapter 4 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Hosea chapter 4 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Hosea Chapter 4 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Hosea Chapter 4.

questions.question: According to Hosea 4:1, why does the LORD have a controversy with the inhabitants of the land?
options: Because there is no truth, nor mercy, nor knowledge of God in the land
Because they did not offer sacrifices
questions.correctAnswer: Because there is no truth, nor mercy, nor knowledge of God in the land
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:1 states that the LORD has a controversy with the inhabitants because there is no truth, nor mercy, nor knowledge of God in the land.

questions.question: What sins are mentioned in Hosea 4:2 as breaking out in the land?
options: Swearing, lying, killing, stealing, and committing adultery
questions.correctAnswer: Swearing, lying, killing, stealing, and committing adultery
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:2 lists swearing, lying, killing, stealing, and committing adultery as the sins breaking out in the land.

questions.question: According to Hosea 4:3, what will happen to the beasts of the field and the fowls of heaven?
options: They shall languish and be taken away
questions.correctAnswer: They shall languish and be taken away
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:3 explains that the land will mourn and all dwellers, including beasts and fowls, will languish and be taken away.

questions.question: Hosea 4:4 tells us not to do what with one another?
questions.correctAnswer: Strive or reprove another
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:4 instructs that no man should strive nor reprove another because the people are like those who strive with the priest.

questions.question: What consequence does Hosea 4:5 say will happen to the people and the prophet?
options: They shall fall, and the mother shall be destroyed
questions.correctAnswer: They shall fall, and the mother shall be destroyed
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:5 states that the people will fall in the day, the prophet at night, and the mother will be destroyed.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Hosea 4:6: 'My people are destroyed for lack of ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: knowledge
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:6 clearly states that the people are destroyed for lack of knowledge.

questions.question: What will God do to those who have rejected knowledge, according to Hosea 4:6?
options: Reject them so they shall be no priest to Him
questions.correctAnswer: Reject them so they shall be no priest to Him
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:6 explains that because they rejected knowledge, God will also reject them so they shall be no priest to Him.

questions.question: True or False: Hosea 4:7 says that as people increased, they sinned against God.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:7 clearly states that as they were increased, so they sinned against God.

questions.question: According to Hosea 4:8, who 'eat up the sin of my people'?
options: Those who set their heart on iniquity
questions.correctAnswer: Those who set their heart on iniquity
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:8 states that those who eat up the sin of the people are those who set their heart on their iniquity.

questions.question: What will happen to the people and priests according to Hosea 4:9?
options: They will be punished for their ways and rewarded for their doings
They will be blessed and honored
They will be exempt from punishment
questions.correctAnswer: They will be punished for their ways and rewarded for their doings
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:9 states that like people will be like priests and God will punish them for their ways and reward them for their doings.

questions.question: True or False: Hosea 4:11 says that whoredom and wine take away the heart.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:11 clearly states that whoredom and wine and new wine take away the heart.

questions.question: According to Hosea 4:12, from where do the people seek counsel?
questions.correctAnswer: At their stocks and staffs
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:12 says the people ask counsel at their stocks and their staff declareth unto them.

questions.question: What kind of sacrifices do the people make according to Hosea 4:13?
options: Upon the tops of mountains and hills under trees
In the temple of the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: Upon the tops of mountains and hills under trees
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:13 describes sacrifices on mountain tops and incense burning under oaks, poplars, and elms.

questions.question: True or False: Hosea 4:15 warns Judah not to offend even if Israel plays the harlot.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:15 cautions Judah not to offend or come to Gilgal or Bethaven even though Israel plays the harlot.

questions.question: How does Hosea 4:16 describe Israel’s behavior?
options: Sliding back as a backsliding heifer
Standing firm like a strong oak
questions.correctAnswer: Sliding back as a backsliding heifer
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:16 compares Israel to a backsliding heifer sliding back.

medium.title: Hosea Chapter 4 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Hosea Chapter 4 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A believer struggles with dishonesty and asks how Hosea 4 teaches about integrity. What biblical truth would you share?
options: Dishonesty leads to a land without truth and mercy
Dishonesty is acceptable if it benefits you
Dishonesty is only wrong if discovered
questions.correctAnswer: Dishonesty leads to a land without truth and mercy
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:1-2 states the land lacks truth and mercy due to swearing and lying, showing dishonesty destroys integrity and fellowship.

questions.question: How does Hosea 4 instruct us about dealing with conflict within the church community?
options: Avoid striving or reproving one another
Strive aggressively to prove your point
questions.correctAnswer: Avoid striving or reproving one another
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:4 advises against striving or reproving, highlighting the importance of unity and humility in church relationships.

questions.question: A believer feels discouraged about lack of spiritual growth. Based on Hosea 4, what key reason is given for this failure?
options: Lack of knowledge of God leads to destruction
God does not care about spiritual growth
questions.correctAnswer: Lack of knowledge of God leads to destruction
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:6 emphasizes destruction comes from rejecting knowledge and forgetting God's law, highlighting the need for devoted learning and obedience.

questions.question: What does Hosea 4 teach about the consequences of leaders sinning against God?
options: The leaders and people will fall together
Only the people suffer, not leaders
questions.correctAnswer: The leaders and people will fall together
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:5 and 4:9 show that like people, like priests; both will be judged for their sins, emphasizing leaders' responsibility to lead righteously.

questions.question: How does Hosea 4 guide believers regarding the influence of sinful practices like adultery and idolatry?
options: Sinful practices lead to shame and punishment
Sinful practices make you more popular
questions.correctAnswer: Sinful practices lead to shame and punishment
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:7-8 and 4:13-14 warn that sin brings shame and destruction, urging believers to avoid adultery and idolatry for spiritual health.

questions.question: What practical advice does Hosea 4 give about seeking guidance and counsel?
options: Seek counsel from God, not from idols or objects
Rely on luck and signs from nature
questions.correctAnswer: Seek counsel from God, not from idols or objects
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:12 condemns seeking counsel from stocks and staffs (idols), teaching reliance on God alone for guidance.

questions.question: How does Hosea 4 describe the effect of wine and whoredom on the heart?
options: They take away the heart, leading to spiritual dullness
They have no effect on the heart
questions.correctAnswer: They take away the heart, leading to spiritual dullness
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:11 states whoredom and wine take away the heart, warning against indulgence that weakens spiritual sensitivity.

questions.question: A believer wonders about the importance of obedience to God's law. How does Hosea 4 explain the result of forgetting God's law?
options: God will also forget their children
questions.correctAnswer: God will also forget their children
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:6 says forgetting God's law results in God rejecting them and forgetting their children, emphasizing obedience's generational impact.

questions.question: True or False: Hosea 4 teaches that spiritual leaders who sin will not face consequences.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:9 clarifies that priests will be punished like the people for their sinful ways, showing leaders face accountability.

questions.question: True or False: The passage encourages believers to trust in idols and objects for guidance.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:12 warns against seeking counsel from idols (stocks and staffs), urging reliance on God alone for guidance.

questions.question: How does Hosea 4:10 teach about consequences related to neglecting the LORD in daily life?
options: They shall eat but not have enough and fail to increase
questions.correctAnswer: They shall eat but not have enough and fail to increase
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:10 states neglecting the LORD results in dissatisfaction and failure to prosper, illustrating the importance of faithfulness.

questions.question: What lesson about humility and contentment can be drawn from Hosea 4:16 where Israel is described as a backsliding heifer?
options: God will care for them tenderly despite their failure
They should boast in their strength
questions.correctAnswer: God will care for them tenderly despite their failure
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:16 shows God will feed Israel as a lamb in a large place, demonstrating His patient care and a call for humility.

questions.question: A believer struggles with temptation toward idolatry. Based on Hosea 4, what should they understand about such behavior?
options: Idolatry separates from God and leads to shame
Idolatry is a harmless cultural practice
questions.correctAnswer: Idolatry separates from God and leads to shame
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:17-19 describes Ephraim joining idols and being bound in shame because of sacrifices, warning of consequences of idolatry.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: "My people are destroyed for lack of _____."
questions.correctAnswer: knowledge
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:6 clearly states destruction comes from lack of knowledge, emphasizing the vital role of knowing God and His law.

questions.question: How does Hosea 4 address the issue of spiritual leadership and their influence on the community?
options: Like people, like priest; leaders are punished for their sins
Leaders are separate from the community consequences
Leaders are immune to sin's effects
Only the people suffer, not the leaders
questions.correctAnswer: Like people, like priest; leaders are punished for their sins
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:9 teaches that priests share the people's guilt and consequences, underscoring responsible leadership.

hard.title: Hosea Chapter 4 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Hosea Chapter 4.

questions.question: What is the primary reason given in Hosea 4:6 for the destruction of the people?
questions.correctAnswer: Lack of knowledge
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:6 explicitly states, 'My people are destroyed for lack of knowledge,' highlighting ignorance as the root cause of their downfall.

questions.question: In Hosea 4:2, which of the following is NOT listed as a sin breaking out among the people?
questions.correctAnswer: Idol worship
questions.explanation: The verse lists swearing, lying, killing, stealing, and adultery but does not specifically mention idol worship in Hosea 4:2.

questions.question: According to Hosea 4:9, how will the LORD deal with priests and people?
options: Punish them for their ways and reward their doings
questions.correctAnswer: Punish them for their ways and reward their doings
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:9 states, 'And there shall be, like people, like priest: and I will punish them for their ways, and reward them their doings,' indicating divine justice.

questions.question: What literary device is illustrated in Hosea 4:8 where it says, 'They eat up the sin of my people'?
questions.correctAnswer: Metaphor
questions.explanation: The phrase 'eat up the sin' metaphorically describes how priests exploit the people's sin for their own gain, as in Hosea 4:8.

questions.question: In Hosea 4:11, what three things are said to take away the heart?
questions.correctAnswer: Whoredom, wine, and new wine
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:11 explicitly states, 'Whoredom and wine and new wine take away the heart,' indicating their spiritual damage.

questions.question: Which verse in Hosea 4 mentions that 'blood toucheth blood' as a consequence of sin?
questions.correctAnswer: Hosea 4:2
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:2 includes the phrase 'blood toucheth blood,' emphasizing escalating violence among the people.

questions.question: What does Hosea 4:12 say the people consult instead of God?
questions.correctAnswer: Their stocks and staff
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:12 describes the people seeking counsel from their stocks and staff, a reference to idolatrous divination practices.

questions.question: True or False: Hosea 4:15 forbids Israel from coming to Gilgal and Bethaven and swearing by the LORD's life.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:15 explicitly commands Israel not to come to Gilgal or Bethaven nor swear 'The LORD liveth,' as they are places associated with unfaithfulness.

questions.question: In Hosea 4:13, what trees are mentioned where people burn incense?
questions.correctAnswer: Oaks, poplars, and elms
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:13 states incense is burned under oaks, poplars, and elms, reflecting pagan worship practices.

questions.question: What is the consequence mentioned in Hosea 4:10 for those who 'have left off to take heed to the LORD'?
options: They shall eat and not have enough and commit whoredom without increase
They shall be blessed with abundance
questions.correctAnswer: They shall eat and not have enough and commit whoredom without increase
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:10 predicts lack of satisfaction and fruitlessness for those who abandon the LORD.

questions.question: Which metaphor is used in Hosea 4:16 to describe Israel's backsliding?
questions.correctAnswer: A backsliding heifer
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:16 uses the image of a backsliding heifer to depict Israel's stubborn return to sin.

questions.question: According to Hosea 4:17, what is Ephraim joined to?
questions.correctAnswer: Idols
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:17 states, 'Ephraim is joined to idols,' showing their idolatrous attachment.

questions.question: In Hosea 4:14, why will the LORD not punish the daughters and spouses for their sins?
options: Because they themselves are separated with whores and sacrifice with harlots
Because the priests intercede for them
questions.correctAnswer: Because they themselves are separated with whores and sacrifice with harlots
questions.explanation: The verse states that the daughters and spouses are not punished because they share in the guilt and unfaithfulness themselves.

questions.question: What is the significance of the phrase 'like people, like priest' in Hosea 4:9?
options: It points to the parallel corruption of leaders and people
It praises the unity of Israel
It proclaims the holiness of the priests
It predicts the coming of a new prophet
questions.correctAnswer: It points to the parallel corruption of leaders and people
questions.explanation: The phrase indicates that the moral failings of the people are mirrored by their priests, implying shared guilt.

questions.question: What does Hosea 4:19 metaphorically describe as binding Israel in their shame?
options: The wind binding her up in her wings
questions.correctAnswer: The wind binding her up in her wings
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:19 uses the metaphor of wind binding Israel's wings, symbolizing restraint and shame due to their sacrifices.

theological.title: Hosea Chapter 4 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Hosea Chapter 4 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Hosea 4:1, why does the LORD have a controversy with the inhabitants of the land?
options: Because there is no truth, nor mercy, nor knowledge of God in the land
Because they worship idols and burn incense on hills
Because they commit adultery and steal
Because they refuse to offer sacrifices
questions.correctAnswer: Because there is no truth, nor mercy, nor knowledge of God in the land
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:1 clearly states the LORD's controversy arises from the absence of truth, mercy, and knowledge of God in the land, highlighting the people's spiritual ignorance and moral failure. This aligns with Proverbs 1:7, Jeremiah 4:22, and John 8:44 where lack of truth and knowledge leads to judgment.

questions.question: What sins are listed in Hosea 4:2 as breaking out among the people?
options: Swearing, lying, killing, stealing, and committing adultery
Coveting, false prophecy, rebellion, and greed
questions.correctAnswer: Swearing, lying, killing, stealing, and committing adultery
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:2 explicitly lists these specific sins that are rampant among the people, illustrating the depth of their corruption. This is consistent with the moral failures condemned throughout Scripture such as in Exodus 20:7-16 and Romans 1:29-31.

questions.question: What consequence does Hosea 4:3 describe for the land because of the people's sins?
options: The land shall mourn, and all who dwell therein shall languish, including beasts and birds
The land shall be blessed and fruitful
The land shall be conquered by foreign nations
The land shall be purified by fire
questions.correctAnswer: The land shall mourn, and all who dwell therein shall languish, including beasts and birds
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:3 states that the land itself will mourn and languish along with its inhabitants and creatures, emphasizing the cosmic impact of human sinfulness. This reflects the teaching of Romans 8:22 and Genesis 3:17-18 about creation suffering due to human fallenness.

questions.question: In Hosea 4:6, what is given as the reason for the destruction of God's people?
questions.correctAnswer: Lack of knowledge
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:6 clearly states that 'My people are destroyed for lack of knowledge,' emphasizing the vital importance of knowing God and His law. This is echoed in Proverbs 1:7, Hosea 6:6, and John 17:3 where knowledge of God is foundational to life and salvation.

questions.question: What does God say He will do to those who have rejected knowledge in Hosea 4:6?
options: Reject them so they shall not be priests and forget their children
questions.correctAnswer: Reject them so they shall not be priests and forget their children
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:6 states that God will reject those who reject knowledge, disqualifying them from priestly service and forgetting their children, symbolizing judgment on both present and future generations. This demonstrates God's holiness and justice as seen in Leviticus 10:3 and Ezekiel 44:23.

questions.question: According to Hosea 4:7, how did the people's increase affect their relationship with God?
options: As they increased, they sinned against God
They became more faithful as they grew
Their wealth led them to righteousness
questions.correctAnswer: As they increased, they sinned against God
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:7 indicates that growth in number was accompanied by increased sinfulness, highlighting spiritual decline despite numerical increase. This reflects warnings in Judges 2:10 and Jeremiah 2:13 about forsaking God regardless of prosperity.

questions.question: What does Hosea 4:9 say about the relationship between the people and the priests?
options: Like people, like priest; both will be punished according to their ways
Priests are innocent though the people sin
Priests are elevated above the people in righteousness
questions.correctAnswer: Like people, like priest; both will be punished according to their ways
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:9 stresses the corporate responsibility of leaders and people, declaring that the priests share in the guilt of the people and will be judged accordingly, consistent with Ezekiel 22:26 and James 3:1 emphasizing accountability of spiritual leaders.

questions.question: What is the effect of whoredom and wine on the heart according to Hosea 4:11?
options: They have no effect on the heart
questions.correctAnswer: They take away the heart
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:11 states that whoredom and wine remove the heart, meaning they cause moral and spiritual dullness or corruption. This is consistent with Proverbs 23:29-35 and Isaiah 5:11 where wine leads to loss of discernment and self-control.

questions.question: What misguided counsel do the people seek in Hosea 4:12?
options: They ask counsel at their stocks and staffs (idols)
They consult the Law of Moses
questions.correctAnswer: They ask counsel at their stocks and staffs (idols)
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:12 describes the people's turning away from God to seek guidance from idols ('stocks and staffs'), showing spiritual adultery and error. This reflects Deuteronomy 18:10-12 and Jeremiah 10:3-5 condemning idolatry.

questions.question: What form of worship do the people practice on mountains and hills as described in Hosea 4:13?
options: Sacrificing and burning incense under trees
questions.correctAnswer: Sacrificing and burning incense under trees
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:13 describes illicit worship on high places beneath oaks, poplars, and elms, which was forbidden and associated with pagan practices, as condemned in Leviticus 26:30 and Jeremiah 2:20.

questions.question: Why does God say in Hosea 4:14 He will not punish the daughters and spouses for committing whoredom and adultery?
options: Because they themselves are separated with whores and sacrifice with harlots
Because they are ignorant of their sin
Because God is merciful to them
Because the men repent on their behalf
questions.correctAnswer: Because they themselves are separated with whores and sacrifice with harlots
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:14 indicates that the daughters and spouses share in the guilt by associating with harlots and idolatry, so their judgment is intertwined with theirs. This reflects Ezekiel 16:33 and Romans 1:32 about shared guilt in sin.

questions.question: What warning is given to Judah in Hosea 4:15 concerning Israel’s sin?
options: Judah should not offend or join Israel in sin and false worship
Judah will be blessed despite Israel’s sin
questions.correctAnswer: Judah should not offend or join Israel in sin and false worship
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:15 warns Judah not to follow Israel into spiritual adultery or to swear falsely by the LORD, emphasizing individual and corporate responsibility, consistent with Ezekiel 18:20 and Deuteronomy 13:12-15.

questions.question: How does Hosea 4:16 metaphorically describe Israel’s spiritual condition?
questions.correctAnswer: As a backsliding heifer
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:16 uses the image of a backsliding heifer to depict Israel’s stubborn and rebellious turning away from God, which parallels Jeremiah 3:14 and Proverbs 14:9 where backsliding symbolizes unfaithfulness.

questions.question: What does God say about Ephraim in Hosea 4:17?
options: Ephraim is joined to idols; let him alone
Ephraim leads the people to repentance
questions.correctAnswer: Ephraim is joined to idols; let him alone
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:17 states that Ephraim is so entrenched in idolatry that God says 'let him alone,' signaling judgment and warning, similar to Isaiah 1:4 and Jeremiah 7:9 about persistent rebellion and idolatry.

questions.question: What characterizes the rulers of Israel in Hosea 4:18?
options: They commit whoredom continually and love shame
They lead the people in righteousness
questions.correctAnswer: They commit whoredom continually and love shame
questions.explanation: Hosea 4:18 condemns the rulers for persistent spiritual adultery and embracing shameful behavior, reflecting warnings in Ezekiel 34:2-4 and Micah 3:1-3 about corrupt leadership.
